metadata.title: CVE-2021-29956 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenPGP secret keys that were imported using Thunderbird version 78.8.1 upto version 78.10.1 were stored unencrypted on the user's local disk. Themaster password protection was inactive for those keys. Version 78.10.2will restore the protection mechanism for newly imported keys, and willautomatically protect keys that had been imported using affectedThunderbird versions. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
